name: Laura Pullover
description: A sweater to transition through the seasons -- a sweet mock neck and a simple raglan yoke flow into a slightly cropped body and three-quarter length sleeves. This piece is worked at a worsted-weight gauge, so your yarn possibilities are endless! Mix yarns as we’ve done here, or pick your favorite worsted-weight yarn and have a go. Stripes, marls, color-blocking -- it all works!
suggested_yarn: Spincycle Yarns Dyed in the Wool
full_text: A sweater to transition through the seasons -- a sweet mock neck and a simple raglan yoke flow into a slightly cropped body and three-quarter length sleeves. This piece is worked at a worsted-weight gauge, so your yarn possibilities are endless! Mix yarns as we’ve done here, or pick your favorite worsted-weight yarn and have a go. Stripes, marls, color-blocking -- it all works! SAMPLES SHOWN Pink sweater shown in size 2 (39”) with 7” of ease in Dimond Laine Elmer Fingering in color Pop Rocks held together with Dimond Laine Birdie in color Cake Pop. Gray sweater shown in size 3 (42.5”) with 6.5” of ease in Spincycle Yarns Dyed in the Wool in color Pinky Swear held together with Dimond Laine Birdie in color Thunder. SIZES 1 (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9) FINISHED MEASUREMENTS 35.5 (39, 42.5, 46, 50, 53.5, 58, 61.5, 64)“ YARN REQUIREMENTS Please note these are yarn estimates. The amount used will depend on yarn, your personal gauge, and any modifications you make. Dimond Laine Elmer Fingering (80% merino, 20% cashmere; 200 yards per 50g or 400 yards per 100g) OR Spincycle Yarns Dyed in the Wool (100% wool; 200 yards per 50g); 4 (5, 5, 5, 6, 7, 7, 8, 8) 50g skeins AND Dimond Laine Birdie (74% alpaca, 26% silk; 328 yards per 50g); 3 (3, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 5, 5) skeins. OR Approx. 756 (820, 936, 984, 1099, 1218, 1312, 1498, 1593) yards / 687 (750, 851, 900, 1000, 1107, 1200, 1362, 1448)m EACH in a fingering/sport weight and a fluffy light fingering weight yarn to hold together throughout. Alternatively, you may also use one strand of a worsted-weight yarn. NEEDLES Needles listed are suggested. Gauge Needle: US 7 (4.5mm) 9”/22.5cm OR DPNs, 16”/40cm, 24”/60cm, and 32”/80cm circular needles. Ribbing Needle: Size US 5/ 3.75mm 9”/22.5cm OR DPNs, 32”/80cm circular needles or 2 sizes smaller than Gauge Needle. TOOLS 5 markers (one unique for BOR); Tapestry needle. GAUGE 18 sts and 23 rnds = 4” / 10cm Stockinette st in the round with Gauge Needle, blocked.
